pageContext.claim: “But here's the thing: When people come in illegally, and then it's crowded -- and I've seen some of those places, and they are run beautifully. They're clean. They're good. They do a great job.”
pageContext.analysis: A report from the Department of Homeland Security's inspector general found dangerous overcrowding and squalid conditions at border detention centers in the Rio Grande Valley in Texas. A Washington Post reporter who visited border detention centers as part of a group with Vice President Pence found that one center housing children was relatively clean and air conditioned, while another center housing mostly men was overcrowded, hot and dirty.
